history.content:
I switched from BioE to EECS (well, declared a double major, but they may be the same requirements) and iirc the GPA requirement was overall, and you had to take a certain number of EECS courses, and get the same GPA req. in those EECS courses.

---------------

You need a 3.3 overall, 3.3 technical GPA (non-humanities), and 3.3 EECS GPA (with one EE/CS class per semester enrolled).

I switched from BioE to EECS (well, declared a double major, but they may be the same requirements) and iirc the GPA requirement was overall, and you had to take a certain number of EECS courses.

---------------

You need a 3.3 overall, 3.3 technical GPA (non-humanities), and 3.3 EECS GPA (with one EE/CS class per semester enrolled).
I switched from BioE to EECS (well, declared a double major, but they may be the same requirements) and iirc the GPA requirement was overall, and you had to take a certain number of EECS courses.

children.subject: So if you took the required amount of EECS courses to switch (was told it was 2), was the considered GPA just overall (as opposed to just for those two classes)? Or were both considered?

history.content: Does the 3.3 requirement to switch to EECS from another CoE major apply to all lower div EECS requirements (such as Math 53) or is it only specifically EE and CS classes such as the CS61 and EE16 series? Thanks!
history.subject: Switch Majors from CoE to EECS
